testcase.brief: Check static route set on net
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition: BR: Mgt0.x : 10.2.3.1/24 Network1: 192.168.40.0/24 L3sw(connecting to br of vpn client): Ip: 10.2.3.11/24, gateway: 10.2.3.1/24 Network2: 192.168.20.0/24 Network3: 192.168.30.0/24
Test Procedure: 1. Network1 ping network2 to verify, and check log of pkt out interface Open debug on br: _ff id 1 dst-ip network2.ip protocol 1 bidirectional _kdebug fe basic _kdebug fe detail 2. Set static routing to net on network2 CLI: ip route net 192.168.20.0 255.255.255.0 gateway 10.2.3.11 3. Network1 ping network2 to verify , and check log of pkt out interface 4. Delete static route on br and then network1 ping network2 to verify

step.desc: config br1 ${br1.br.lan.kport1} and ${br1.br.lan.kport4} ,enable dhcp-server on the interface
step.telnet:
-v "vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "vlan ${br1.vpc4.vlan}"
-v "interface vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface vlan ${br1.vpc4.vlan}"
-v "user-profile lan1 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute 1" -v "user-profile lan4 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc4.vlan} attribute 4" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport mode access" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport access vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int4} switchport mode access" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int4} switchport access vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport user-profile-attribute 1" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int4} switchport user-profile-attribute 4"
-v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options netmask ${route.netmask}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server enable"
-v "interface vlan${br1.vpc4.vlan} ip ${br1.br.mgt0.4.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc4.vlan} dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.4.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.4.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc4.vlan} dhcp-server options netmask ${route.netmask}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc4.vlan} dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.4.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc4.vlan} dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc4.vlan} dhcp-server enable"
-v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport mode access" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport access vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int4} switchport mode access" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int4} switchport access vlan ${br1.vpc4.vlan}" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport user-profile-attribute 1" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int4} switchport user-profile-attribute 4"

step.desc: set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
set br1.vpc4.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side

step.telnet: -v "_ff id 2 src-ip ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} protocol 1 bidirectional" -v "_ff id 3 protocol 47 bidirectional" -v "_ff id 4 protocol 50 bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail" -v "clear log all"

step.desc: ping pkt will be out from wan interface
BR set static route to network of vpc4.trip
br1.vpc1 ping br1.vpc4,ping is successful after add the static route on the br

stage.step:
ping pkt will be sent to mgt0.x and then out from ethx interface connected to br1.vpc4.trip
step8.1_show_logging_buffered.log
-v "show logging buffered"
-c -i "(i) ${br1.br.lan.kport4} ${br1.vpc4.trip}->${br1.vpc1.tif.ip}" -i "icmp-echo-reply" -c -i "(i) vlan${br1.vpc4.vlan} ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip}->${br1.vpc4.trip}" -i "icmp-echo-req" -c -i "(i) ${br1.br.lan.kport1} ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip}->${br1.vpc4.trip}" -i "icmp-echo-req"-->
next
